main event: An unidentified white light was observed by two observers flying MATS aircraft near Sondrestromfjord Air Base, Greenland, on April 6, 1953.
interesting points: The light was observed to be traveling in a northerly direction at an estimated speed of 165 knots., The observation lasted approximately 3 seconds., Similarities were noted between this sighting and another sighting in Reykjavik, Iceland on April 1, 1953., The altitude of the observed light was estimated to be around 30,000 feet., It was concluded that the phenomenon was probably astronomical in nature (meteor).
